snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey praised a deal to conclude a multibillion-dollar pollution suit against the oil company. Critics say the deal is being made to fill holes in the state budget.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, at town-hall-style meeting in Somerville, NJ, defends decision to settle 2004 pollution lawsuit against Exxon Mobil Corp for $225 million, fraction of what was originally sought; lawmakers and environmental advocates vow to block settlement, saying Christie is eager for money to help prop up state budget.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and BENJAMIN WEISER
byline.contributor: Kate Zernike reported from Somerville, and Benjamin Weiser from New York.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey praised a deal to conclude a multibillion-dollar pollution suit against the oil company. Critics say the deal is being made to fill holes in the state budget.

headline.main: Christie, Defending Exxon Deal, Says Environmental Damage Will Be Repaired
headline.print_headline: Settlement With Exxon Is Defended by Christie
